text.p: Italian bond and futures markets wallowed in negative territory at the end of an uninspired day's trading, with activity dying once the September LIFFE future expired earlier, dealers said.
The Dec LIFFE BTp future was 20 basis points down at 114.71, tracking the U.S. market after the September future expired five basis points up at 115.71.
"We saw good volumes due to the spread and then once the September expired everything died," a broker at a U.S. house in London said.
The February 2006 Btp was 13 basis points down at 100.70.

The lira held fast at 1,020 per mark from the morning. Traders said abroad, everyone was waiting for U.S. non-farm payrolls data due Friday. In Italy, the focus, such as there was, was on Thursday's final consumer prices data for August, after preliminary data indicated 3.3/3.4 percent year on year.

Talks between ministers preparing Italy's 1997 budget for 32.4 trillion lire of deficit cutting measures have not so far produced any change in the target blend of two-thirds from reduced spending and one-third greater revenue, Budget ministry undersecretary Giorgio Macciotta said.
